candidates.title: Content Types
candidates.body:
Successor of failed approach of #199

Work:
 - [ ] Using futures joiners within resolver layer traits
 - [x] Refactor `StreamOrFut` and its sub-futures together - This ends up being hard cause `Future` vs `Stream`
 - [x] Replacing `Stream` with custom trait
 - [ ] Solution for batch decoding using framing -> working w/ Typescript
 - [ ] Solution for batch encoding using framing -> working w/ Typescript
 - [ ] Introduce `ContentType` & `ContentTypes` trait + generics based on `Rspc`
 - [ ] Using custom enum for `Poll` so custom values can be yielded through the chain (both up and down)
 - [ ] Remove the `input: Value` arg through layer system

closes #173

candidates.title: deps: update `cargo` and replace `tempdir`
candidates.body:
The `tempdir` crate has been unmaintained for years, and it's using a vulnerable version of `remove_dir_all` ([source](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2023-0018.html)). This PR replaces `tempdir` with `tempfile`, which means that `cargo audit` is a little happier.

Additionally, the `cargo 0.67.1` package uses `atty v0.2.14` which has a [potential unaligned read](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2021-0145) - I tried to update it fully, but that resulted in dependency issues so `0.68.0` will have to do.

There's still `time v0.1.45` in the tree, but that's due to [chrono](https://github.com/chronotope/chrono/issues/602) and there's not much we can do there aside from wait for a new release (unless we completely drop support for it).

candidates.title: Preliminary support for solid subscriptions & typescript improvements
Finalize create-rspc-app
candidates.body:
Got create-rspc-app on [crates.io](https://crates.io/crates/create-rspc-app) by fixing a few issues with the `include_dir!` macro.

Needs more testing (might test it sometime tomorrow or the day after), but for the most part it works fine.

candidates.title: create-rspc-app: general code cleanup + post generation steps
candidates.body: Fixes most of the issues specified in specta-rs/invent#6.

Needed:
 - [x] Fix router merging
 - [x] httpz integration
 - [x] New middleware syntax
 - [x] Fix faulty SolidJS types
 - [x] Add E2E test for type inference from Rust to Typescript (for `@rspc/client`, `@rspc/react` and `@rspc/solid`)
 - [x] Refactor `@rspc/react` to copy tRPC as close as possible -> Better inference and removing RQ context.
 - [x] Refactor `@rspc/solid` to copy the new React types/methods.
 - [x] Upgrade `@rspc/react` to use Typescript helpers & not hold the React Query context like `@rspc/solid` does.
 - [x] Unit test selection macro Specta output
 - [x] Move examples out into a dedicated crate only using Axum.
 - [x] Clean up & open souce httpz
 - [x] Remove `KeyAndKind`
 - [x] Move from `/rspcws` to `/rspc/ws`
 - [x] Fix subscriptions - Probably split add/remove subscriptions out of core into an abstraction
 - [x] Remove clone bound on TCtx and use `ctx_fn()` many times?
 - [x] Httpz support for accessing request + fix `axum` and `cookies` examples
 - [x] Hack back in Axum extractors + rerelease httpz
 - [x] Make middleware work
      - [x] incoming context switching
      - [x] response
      - [x] every item in stream
 - [x] Fix execute syntax
 - [x] Fix Tauri integration
 - [x] Remove all `todo!()`'s, `.unwrap()`'s, etc
 - [x] Rename `arg` to `input` everywhere
 - [x] Add my standard Rust lints
 - [x] Fix all clipping warnings
 - [x] ~~`useInfiniteQuery` and `createInfiniteQuery`~~
 - [x] ~~`createSubscription`~~
 - [x] Fix `@rspc/solid` in Mattrax & example project
 - [x] Redo documentation website
     - [x] Mobile navbar
     - [x] Fix initial flash when loading docs site
 - [x] Redo documentation
 - [x] Community upgrades:
     - [ ] ~~PR to Prisma Client Rust - upgrade version, upgrade Typescript examples on docs page & add unit tests for TS exporting~~
     - [x] Upgrade Spacedrive
     - [x] Upgrade Twidge
     - [x] Upgrade Mattrax
 - [x] Release

candidates.title: Add nextjs example
candidates.body:
I've been testing RSPC in a Next.js project and thought I could add an example based on it. Also did some extra changes I thought made sense. Let me know if you want any of them reverted.

**Summary:**
- Made Axum example file into an actual project that can be run by Cargo (bindings output to `/examples/bindings.ts`)
- Moved Astro (`packages/example`) into `/examples/astro`
- Added Next.js example to `/examples/nextjs`

I'm not fully sure if the changes made to `Cargo.toml` in root are correct, so please check that.

Fixes issue https://github.com/oscartbeaumont/rspc/issues/43
